regulations.name: EU Taxonomy Regulation
regulations.description: EU regulation creating a classification of environmentally sustainable economic activities to guide investment (in force July 2020).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: The obligation to report against the EU Taxonomy is directly linked to being in scope of the CSRD.

rules.description: Applies to any company that is subject to the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD).

regulations.name: Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation (SFDR)
regulations.description: EU regulation requiring financial market participants and advisers to disclose how they integrate ESG factors into investment decisions (in force March 2021).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: Applies to financial market participants and financial advisers in the EU.

rules.description: Applies to entities such as investment firms, pension funds, asset managers, insurance companies, and credit institutions offering portfolio management.

regulations.name: Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD)
regulations.description: EU directive requiring large companies to publish annual sustainability (ESG) reports according to common standards (replacing the Non-Financial Reporting Directive).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: CSRD applies if a company meets the criteria of ANY of the following rules. Phased application dates depend on the specific rule met.

rules.ruleName: Large EU Undertaking or Large EU Group
rules.description: Applies to companies exceeding at least two of the following three criteria.
Applies to any company with securities listed on an EU regulated market (excluding micro-undertakings).
Applies to the group if the ultimate non-EU parent generates significant turnover within the EU.

regulations.name: Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD)
regulations.description: EU directive requiring large companies to identify and mitigate human rights and environmental impacts in their global value chains (adopted May 2024, implementation by 2028).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: CSDDD has very high thresholds and applies if EITHER of the following rules are met.

rules.description: Applies to very large EU companies based on both employee numbers and worldwide turnover.
Applies to very large non-EU companies based on turnover generated within the EU.

regulations.name: Act on Corporate Due Diligence in Supply Chains (Lieferkettengesetz)
regulations.description: German law requiring large companies to ensure human rights and environmental standards throughout their supply chains (effective January 2023).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: The LkSG applies based on the number of employees within Germany.

rules.description: Applies to companies that have their central administration, principal place of business, or registered seat in Germany and typically employ at least 1,000 employees in Germany.

regulations.name: Federal Climate Protection Act (Bundes-Klimaschutzgesetz)
regulations.description: German climate law setting binding national emission reduction targets (updated June 2024) to ensure climate neutrality by 2045.

applicabilityCriteria.notes: This is a framework law setting national targets. It does not have direct applicability thresholds for individual companies in the same way as reporting directives, but it informs all other climate-related policy and regulation.

rules.description: Framework law affecting all sectors through national climate policy.

regulations.name: Energy Transition Law (Article 173-VI)
regulations.description: French law requiring institutional investors to disclose how climate-related risks are managed (amending the Monetary and Financial Code).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: Applies specifically to institutional investors.

rules.description: Aims at asset owners and asset managers.

regulations.name: Duty of Vigilance Law
regulations.description: French law requiring large companies to prevent human rights and environmental violations in their supply chains (due diligence obligations).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: France's pioneering due diligence law, which will co-exist with the EU CSDDD.

rules.description: Applies to companies with their head office in France and employing, with their direct/indirect subsidiaries, over 5,000 employees in France.
Applies to companies with their head office in France and employing, with their direct/indirect subsidiaries, over 10,000 employees worldwide.

regulations.name: Energy and Climate Law (Article 29, 2019)
regulations.description: Law requiring financial institutions and large companies to disclose climate and biodiversity-related impacts (mandatory biodiversity reporting from 2022).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: Strengthens disclosure for financial entities, including biodiversity.

rules.description: Broadly applies to financial institutions operating in France.

regulations.name: Swiss Code of Obligations Article 964-2 (Non-Financial Reporting)
regulations.description: Amendment to Swiss company law requiring large companies to report on ESG (non-financial) matters (effective for 2022 financial year).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: Applies to Swiss Public Interest Entities (PIEs) meeting specific size thresholds.

rules.description: Must have over 500 employees AND exceed one of two financial thresholds in two consecutive years.

regulations.name: Ordinance on Climate Disclosures (Switzerland)
regulations.description: Swiss ordinance requiring large companies to publish climate-related financial disclosures aligned with TCFD (effective January 2024).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: Applicability is tied to the same criteria as the Swiss Code of Obligations for non-financial reporting.

rules.description: Must have over 500 employees AND exceed one of two financial thresholds in two consecutive years.

regulations.name: UK Sustainability Disclosure Requirements (SDR)
regulations.description: UK regulation establishing sustainability disclosure requirements for financial institutions (analogous to the EU SFDR), with phased implementation from April 2024.

applicabilityCriteria.notes: Applies to UK-based financial services firms and asset managers.

rules.description: Applies to UK-regulated financial institutions, including asset managers, with assets under management exceeding a certain threshold (e.g., £5 billion).

regulations.name: Companies (Strategic Report) (Climate-related Financial Disclosure) Regulations
regulations.description: UK regulation requiring many large companies and financial institutions to report climate-related financial risks in line with TCFD recommendations (effective for 2022/23 reports).

applicabilityCriteria.notes: Applies to large UK companies and LLPs, whether listed or private.

rules.description: Applies to UK companies with over 500 employees and a turnover of more than £500 million.
Applies to UK registered companies whose shares are traded on a UK regulated market.
